posts.title: Do Small Businesses Really Need Managed Devices?
posts.summary: Many small businesses grow quickly without setting up device management or identity providers. While this may work in the beginning, unmanaged devices create security, productivity, and scaling risks. In this post, Josiah Ledua from Backslash Designs explores the dangers of unmanaged growth and why starting early with the right tools can save headaches down the road.
author: Josiah Ledua
posts.body:
## Do Small Businesses Really Need Managed Devices?
![Test Post Banner](../media/test-post-banner.png)


### A Growing Business, A Growing Problem

Imagine a small business that started with just a few employees and a couple of computers. At first, everything was simple ‚Äî one shared admin password, a few local accounts, and no real thought given to centralized management. Fast forward a few years, and now the team has grown to dozens of staff and devices. Suddenly, that simple setup is a nightmare. No one is quite sure who has access to what, onboarding and offboarding are messy, and security feels like an afterthought.  

Rolling out an identity provider like **Active Directory**, **Entra ID**, or an **MDM solution** at this stage feels overwhelming ‚Äî not just technically, but financially.  

---

### Do We Really Need Managed Devices?

It‚Äôs tempting to think: *Why bother?* Local-only admin accounts still ‚Äúwork,‚Äù and upgrading feels expensive. But unmanaged devices bring hidden risks:  

- **Security holes** ‚Äì Lost or stolen laptops can still access company files.  
- **Inconsistent updates** ‚Äì Without management, some devices go unpatched, leaving vulnerabilities.  
- **Onboarding chaos** ‚Äì New staff need manual setup, creating inconsistent experiences.  
- **Offboarding risk** ‚Äì Former employees may retain access to sensitive data.  

The longer a business grows without proper device management, the harder ‚Äî and more expensive ‚Äî it becomes to fix.  

---

### The Benefit of Starting Early

The best time to implement identity and device management is **before the pain begins**. By setting up an identity provider or MDM when your business is still small, you create:  

- **Scalability** ‚Äì Easily add new users and devices as you grow.  
- **Security** ‚Äì Centralized access control reduces risks from lost devices or staff turnover.  
- **Reliability** ‚Äì Consistent updates and policies ensure devices stay compliant.  

Starting early positions your business to grow smoothly instead of patching problems later.  

---

### Ready to Future-Proof Your Business?

If your business is starting to feel the pain of unmanaged growth, you don‚Äôt have to tackle it alone. At **Backslash Designs**, we help small businesses make the jump to scalable, secure, and reliable IT solutions ‚Äî tailored to your needs and budget.

## What is a Password Manager? A Beginner-Friendly Guide for Small Businesses
![Test Post Banner](../media/test-post-banner.png)

# What Exactly is a Password Manager (and Why It‚Äôs So Important)

_By Josiah Ledua, Backslash Designs_

## Why I‚Äôm Writing This

Every small business I‚Äôve worked with has run into the same problem: too many accounts, too many passwords, and too many sticky notes.  
When I first started consulting, I realized that passwords weren‚Äôt just a nuisance‚Äîthey were a major **security risk**. Weak passwords, reused passwords, or forgotten passwords can all put your business at risk.  

That‚Äôs why I wanted to write this post: to explain, in plain English, what password managers do and how they can make your business safer, more efficient, and less stressed about logins.

---

## What is a Password Manager?

A password manager is a secure ‚Äúvault‚Äù that stores all your passwords in one place. Instead of remembering dozens (or hundreds) of logins, you only need to remember **one master password**.  

The password manager then generates, stores, and autofills strong, unique passwords for each of your accounts.  

Think of it as a digital keyring‚Äîexcept instead of weak keys written on scraps of paper, you have military-grade encryption protecting your credentials.

---

## Why You Should Care About Password Managers

Passwords are the front door to your business‚Äôs data, finances, and reputation. Here‚Äôs why using a password manager matters:

### 1. Stronger, Unique Passwords Without the Hassle
- **80% of breaches involve weak or reused passwords.** ([Verizon DBIR](https://www.verizon.com/business/resources/reports/dbir/))  
- With a password manager, you can generate complex passwords like `2h#R!9LwQf!7` without ever needing to remember them.  

### 2. Saves Time and Reduces Login Frustration
- No more resetting passwords because you forgot them.  
- Autofill works across devices‚Äîdesktop, laptop, phone, tablet‚Äîso staff can log in quickly and securely.  

### 3. Simplifies Onboarding & Offboarding
When you hire a new employee, you can share access to the accounts they need (without giving away the actual passwords).  
When someone leaves, you can revoke their access in one step, instead of hunting down every account they had.  

### 4. Secure Sharing Without Sending Passwords by Email
- No more texting or emailing logins.  
- Most password managers let you share access securely, and some (like 1Password and Bitwarden) allow **role-based permissions**.  

### 5. Protection Against Phishing & Breaches
- Password managers only autofill credentials on the correct website‚Äîhelping prevent phishing attacks.  
- If one site is hacked, only that unique password is compromised, not your entire business.  

---

## Popular Password Managers for Small Businesses

Here are some trusted options:  

- **1Password** ‚Äì Great for small businesses, with admin controls and family plan bundles.  
- **Bitwarden** ‚Äì Open-source, affordable, and supports self-hosting.  
- **LastPass** ‚Äì Widely used, though it has had security incidents (always worth evaluating carefully).  
- **Dashlane** ‚Äì Good for ease-of-use, with dark web monitoring.  

---

## How to Get Started

1. **Pick a Password Manager**  
   Choose based on your needs: business features, budget, self-hosting, or ease-of-use.  
   
2. **Set a Strong Master Password**  
   This is the one password you‚Äôll actually need to remember‚Äîmake it long and memorable.  

3. **Import or Save Accounts as You Go**  
   Most managers will capture logins automatically as you log in.  

4. **Roll It Out to Your Team**  
   Train staff on how to use it. Make sure everyone understands why it matters.  

5. **Enable Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA)**  
   Wherever possible, pair your password manager with MFA for extra protection.  

---

## Need Help Choosing the Right Tool?

Password managers can feel like ‚Äúone more thing to set up,‚Äù but in reality they **save time and prevent disasters**.  

At **Backslash Designs**, we help small businesses set up password managers, train teams, and build secure workflows that are **scalable, reliable, and secure**.  

üëâ [Contact us today](https://www.backslashdesigns.ca/contact) to find out how we can help secure your business.

author: Josiah Ledua
posts.body:
## What is SEO? A Beginner-Friendly Guide for Small Businesses ![Test Post Banner](../media/test-post-banner.png) # What Exactly is SEO (and Why It‚Äôs So Confusing) _By Josiah Ledua, Backslash Designs_ ## Why I‚Äôm Writing This When I first started digging into SEO, I‚Äôll be honest‚Äîit felt like I stumbled into a dictionary full of acronyms and jargon. CTR, SERP, DA, backlinks, meta descriptions‚Ä¶ it seemed like a secret language reserved for marketers. As someone who works in IT and builds websites, I realized that if _I_ found it confusing, then many small business owners probably do too. That‚Äôs why I wanted to write this post: to strip away the jargon and give you a simple, practical way to understand what SEO is, why it matters, and how you can improve it without needing to become an expert. --- ## What is SEO? SEO stands for **Search Engine Optimization**. Put simply, it‚Äôs the process of making your website easier for search engines (like Google or Bing) to find, understand, and recommend. Think of search engines like librarians. Their job is to scan billions of ‚Äúbooks‚Äù (websites) and deliver the most useful, trustworthy, and relevant ones when someone types a question. SEO is about making sure your website is catalogued in a way that search engines understand‚Äîso that your business shows up when potential customers are looking. --- ## Why You Should Care About SEO? When I first dipped my toes into SEO, it wasn‚Äôt obvious _why_ I should spend time on it. Now, having seen what it can do (for my own sites and for clients), I believe it‚Äôs one of the best long-term investments a small business can make. Here‚Äôs why: ### 1. You‚Äôll Reach Customers Who Are Already Searching People are using Google (or Bing, DuckDuckGo, etc.) to look for things _right now_ ‚Äî like ‚ÄúIT support near me,‚Äù ‚Äúhow to fix my network,‚Äù or ‚Äúsmall business cybersecurity in Toronto.‚Äù If your website is optimized, it‚Äôs more likely to show up when someone types those phrases. ![Channel share ‚Äî BrightEdge (reproduced)](../media/bright-edge-seo-share-2019.png "chartId=bright-edge-seo-share-2019") *Source: BrightEdge Research* - **68% of all online experiences begin with a search engine.** ([DemandSage](https://www.demandsage.com/seo-statistics/?utm_source=chatgpt.com "146 SEO Statistics 2025 ‚Äì AI Trends, Overviews & Market Share")) - **53.3% of all website traffic comes from organic searches.** ([Intergrowth¬Æ](https://intergrowth.com/seo/stats/?utm_source=chatgpt.com "61 Mind-Bottling SEO Stats for 2025 | Intergrowth¬Æ")) That means over half of the visits websites receive are from people just typing queries into search engines ‚Äî not from ads, not from social media, not from direct links. ### 2. High Click-Through Rates for Top Results Getting on page 2 (or lower) is kind of like being invisible. Most people don‚Äôt scroll that far. - **The top organic search result often gets ~25‚Äì40% of clicks.** ([All in One SEO](https://aioseo.com/seo-statistics/?utm_source=chatgpt.com "83 SEO Statistics for 2025 (Current & Verified ) - AIOSEO")) - **The top three results get a big majority of all clicks.** ([All in One SEO](https://aioseo.com/seo-statistics/?utm_source=chatgpt.com "83 SEO Statistics for 2025 (Current & Verified ) - AIOSEO")) - **75% of users never go past the first page of results.** ([All in One SEO](https://aioseo.com/seo-statistics/?utm_source=chatgpt.com "83 SEO Statistics for 2025 (Current & Verified ) - AIOSEO")) So every step you move up in search rankings can make a big difference in how many visitors you get. ### 3. It‚Äôs Cost-Effective & Long-Term Unlike paid ads (which stop when you stop paying), SEO is like planting seeds. Over time, it builds value ‚Äî links, content, trust ‚Äî which compounds. - Many businesses see **positive ROI on SEO within 6‚Äì12 months**, and peak returns in years 2‚Äì3. ([SeoProfy](https://seoprofy.com/blog/seo-roi-statistics/?utm_source=chatgpt.com "SEO ROI Statistics for 2025 - SeoProfy")) - One study reports **an average return of 748%** (i.e. $7.48 back for every $1 spent) from SEO. ([Single Grain](https://www.singlegrain.com/seo/is-it-worth-investing-into-seo-in-2025-the-data-proves-it/?utm_source=chatgpt.com "Is It Worth Investing Into SEO in 2025? The Data Proves It")) - Another finding: **91% of marketers reported SEO had a positive impact** on their website performance and marketing goals. ([Conductor](https://www.conductor.com/academy/state-of-organic-marketing/?utm_source=chatgpt.com "[Research Report] The State of SEO in 2025 - Conductor")) SEO is not ‚Äúfree‚Äù ‚Äî you do need to invest time, quality content, etc. ‚Äî but the returns often far exceed many other marketing channels. ### 4. It Builds Authority and Credibility When your site ranks high, people tend to trust it more ‚Äî search engines see it as more ‚Äúreliable,‚Äù and users see it as more legit. Over time, that builds brand authority. Also, being consistently visible in search builds awareness: people may see your brand name multiple times over different searches. ### 5. It Supports Other Marketing Efforts SEO and content help your business in more ways than just Google rankings: - You‚Äôll have content to share on social media, newsletters, or link to in proposals. - People who find your site via search are often further down the funnel ‚Äî they‚Äôre looking for services, not just browsing. - SEO helps your website‚Äôs foundation (structure, speed, mobile-friendliness), which also boosts conversion rates and user experience. ### 6. Local & ‚ÄúNear Me‚Äù Searches Are Powerful If you serve a specific region (city, county, province), local SEO matters a lot. - **46% of all searches are for a local business or local service.** ([Backlinko](https://backlinko.com/seo-stats?utm_source=chatgpt.com "74 Important SEO Statistics for 2025 - Backlinko")) - **After someone does a local search on mobile, 76% of them end up visiting that business the same day.** ([Backlinko](https://backlinko.com/seo-stats?utm_source=chatgpt.com "74 Important SEO Statistics for 2025 - Backlinko")) For an MSP like ours, where clients are often local or regional, that kind of visibility can directly translate into service calls. --- ### How to Improve SEO SEO can feel overwhelming, but here are a few simple ways you can improve it: 1. **Use Clear Titles and Descriptions** Every page should have a title and description that explains what it‚Äôs about. ```html IT Services in Thunder Bay | Backslash Designs ``` 2. **Make Your Site Mobile-Friendly** Google favors sites that look good and load fast on mobile devices. 3. **Use Headings to Organize Content** ```html

Our IT Services

Cloud Solutions

Cybersecurity

``` Headings tell both readers _and_ search engines what‚Äôs important on the page. 4. **Write for Humans First** Don‚Äôt just stuff keywords everywhere. Write in a natural way that answers the kinds of questions your customers actually ask. 5. **Link to Other Pages** Adding links between your own pages (and linking to other credible sites) helps search engines understand your site better. --- ### Need Help Getting Started? SEO doesn‚Äôt have to be a mystery‚Äîand you don‚Äôt need to tackle it alone. At **Backslash Designs**, we help small businesses build websites that are **scalable, reliable, and secure**‚Äîand that includes making sure people can actually _find_ them online. üëâ [Contact us today](https://www.backslashdesigns.ca/contact) to learn how we can help your business grow with better SEO.
